name: sfchronicle
text:
Around the Bay Area today, throngs of people from Fremont to Santa Rosa continued to raise their voices against police brutality.

https://t.co/VxwEwAtzNL

name: sfchronicle
text:
Thousands marched throughout San Francisco, some on the Golden Gate Bridge and some in the Mission District. 

Phot… https://t.co/ILaLkC8zz1

name: sfchronicle
text:
San Jose's police chief  said he spoke with Derrick Sanderlin, a community activist who has helped train police in bias and says he was shot in the groin with a rubber projectile fired by police. 

"I assured him we will be investigating this incident." https://t.co/BzzDIuTwUb

name: sfchronicle
text:
BREAKING: A wildfire burning just southwest of Winters in Solano County has prompted mandatory evacuations.

The blaze burned 150 acres and was 0% contained as of 5:15 p.m. #QuailFire https://t.co/6HMs0frDrj

name: sfchronicle
text:
"It’s devastating. It’s heartbreaking. It’s unreal." Since Mayor London Breed announced her plan to improve the Tenderloin neighborhood a month ago, the long-neglected area has hit new lows, writes @HeatherKnightSF.

https://t.co/fQFf4gH9AJ

name: sfchronicle
text:
SF released guidance on social interactions as the city prepares to reopen:
▪️Outdoor activities are safest
▪️Wear a mask indoors
▪️Avoid using other people's bathrooms
▪️Hang out with as few people as possible
▪️Avoid singing or shouting https://t.co/Rjvf2E62pK

name: sfchronicle
text: The Berkeley protest, which at one point was so large that it spilled into the streets on both sides of Martin Luther King Jr. Way, quietly dissipated without any obvious police activity. https://t.co/vOhqV3EjGJ

name: sfchronicle
text: BREAKING: The #QuailFire burning near Vacaville has grown to 500 acres, according to Cal Fire. Fires over 100 acres each are also burning in Sonoma and Contra Costa counties. https://t.co/1Cgu690ggs

name: sfchronicle
text: JUST IN: The Vallejo police officer who shot and killed S.F. resident Sean Monterrosa outside of a Walgreens has been identified. The officer has been involved in three non-fatal shootings since 2015. https://t.co/2eUJSoliSB

name: sfchronicle
text:
Emeryville police noted temporary road closures this evening:

• Southbound Christie Ave at Powell St.
• Southbound Shellmound St. at Shellmound Way 
• Westbound 40th St at Horton St.

There is an increased police presence to deter criminal activity. https://t.co/BV2guHzyqA

name: sfchronicle
text: JUST IN: The #QuailFire burning north of Vacaville has grown to 1,200 acres and was 5% contained as of 9 p.m. https://t.co/nCisXgxO8F

name: sfchronicle
text: Update: A Santa Cruz County sheriff's sergeant was killed in an ambush with “gunfire and multiple improvised explosives” in Ben Lomond this afternoon. One other deputy and a CHP officer were injured in the attack. https://t.co/Jx5OtYUHVY

name: sfchronicle
text:
“He will be remembered as a hero who devoted his life to protecting the community and as a loving husband and father.” — Gov. Gavin Newsom
https://t.co/jV9ub08ohJ

name: sfchronicle
text:
When looters rolled into Union Square, the cameras were rolling as well. Now many may find themselves starring in their own crime drama. 

More from @philmatier: https://t.co/86J73HktJs

name: sfchronicle
text: Today's front page: the stories San Francisco is talking about this morning. https://t.co/sgK7iFvtYo https://t.co/OEpD5zC2eJ

name: sfchronicle
text: Today's front page: In San Francisco, the Golden Gate Bridge closed on Saturday as thousands of protesters marched… https://t.co/Qoy39R43ZR

name: sfchronicle
text: Worried about your exposure to the coronavirus during Bay Area protests? You can now get a free COVID-19 test in San Francisco. https://t.co/0CeMak7Z6X

name: sfchronicle
text: Getting tested is not a foolproof way of ensuring you will not transmit the coronavirus. Experts advise getting tested as close as possible to the day you plan to come into contact with someone. https://t.co/GKPdYohxQ9

name: sfchronicle
text:
The Quail Fire in Solano County, just north of Vacaville, grew to 1,400 acres this morning. 

The fire was 10% contained as of 8 a.m.

Read more: https://t.co/lFCebypWeR https://t.co/NdIUo0YEsg

text:

name: sfchronicle
text:
New housing on contaminated property? Here's how San Francisco sidestepped state law on developing toxic sites — a Chronicle exclusive report.
https://t.co/6SkEcN8iEe

name: sfchronicle
text:
A crucial factor that will influence how and when PG&E wildfire victims get paid remains unresolved.
https://t.co/9yaSl7upbF

name: sfchronicle
text:
CHP officers shot and killed a man and shot a woman late Saturday night in Oakland. 

The shootings come amid increasing unrest over police brutality and systemic racism, sparked by the death of George Floyd in Minneapolis police custody.
https://t.co/0f297jnaC3

name: sfchronicle
text:
A record 116,346 San Franciscans — roughly one-fifth the city’s workforce — have either lost their job or had work hours reduced to the point where they could file for assistance since March.
https://t.co/7U0IcdouYt

name: sfchronicle
text:
From home kitchens to your doorstep: Here's how cooks and entrepreneurs are firing up impromptu food businesses amid the pandemic.
https://t.co/TaGPs6QhRK

name: sfchronicle
text:
Some activists, lawyers and drivers want Uber and Lyft drivers to receive regular unemployment as employees, not gig workers. They say the benefits could add up to more and last longer. 
https://t.co/NlfNvYVITt

name: sfchronicle
text:
“It made me feel like I wasn’t going to accidentally kill my family.”

How to figure out if you should I get a coronavirus test before seeing friends and family: https://t.co/mstIWGXpvM

name: sfchronicle
text:
“He’s the embodiment of team chemistry.”

On the dedication page of her new book on team chemistry, “Intangibles,” former Chronicle columnist Joan Ryan writes: To Mike Krukow.
https://t.co/hSo4tQ0eus

name: sfchronicle
text:
Vallejo police and officials have declined to name the officer who fired the shot that killed an unarmed 22-year old man outside a Walgreens on Tuesday, saying only that he opened fire because he mistook a hammer in Sean Monterrosa’s pocket for a gun.
https://t.co/5fOYTlUnvy

name: sfchronicle
text:
Former Republican Secretary of State Colin Powell said today that President Trump has “drifted away” from the Constitution, criticizing Trump’s strongman response to protests surrounding the police killing of George Floyd.
https://t.co/HK6SFMupVa

name: sfchronicle
text:
An active-duty Air Force sergeant has been arrested in the ambush-style shooting death of a deputy with the Santa Cruz County Sheriff’s Office on Saturday afternoon in Ben Lomond.
https://t.co/ycp5HlYYsn

name: sfchronicle
text: Looters who hit SF’s fashionable Union Square during the protests may be in for a surprise, writes @philmatier. https://t.co/AlzAzEn00Q

name: sfchronicle
text:
An active-duty Air Force sergeant is arrested in the ambush-style shooting of a Santa Cruz County deputy. He will be charged with murder and other felonies, Santa Cruz County Sheriff Jim Hart said.
https://t.co/LznlRX0q3s

name: sfchronicle
text:
Your COVID crew. Pandemic pod. Or as Alameda County labeled it, “social bubble." 

Across the Bay Area, friends and families are figuring out how to reopen their social lives, linking up in small, trusted groups.
https://t.co/7FGXeKvyjH
